titles.title: Transit System Flexibility Protection Act of 2004
A bill to amend title 49, United States Code, to allow additional transit systems greater flexibility with certain mass transportation projects.
Transit System Flexibility Protection Act of 2004

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: Transit System Flexibility Protection Act of 2004 - Permits the Secretary of Transportation to make mass transportation formula grants for an urbanized area with a population of more than 200,000 if the transit system operates fewer than 100 buses on fixed route service during peak hours.
